intro: Galium verum var. pseudolittorale, commonly known as the lesser bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous minute seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
